title: Low Water Stress Levels
description: In 2021, Congo had a water stress level of only 2.74%, indicating a sustainable use of its freshwater resources. This is one of the lowest levels globally.

title: Minimal Freshwater Withdrawals
description: Congo's annual freshwater withdrawals were just 2.07% of its internal resources in 2021, showcasing efficient water management practices.

title: Limited Surgical Procedures
description: In 2018, Congo performed only 49 surgical procedures per 100,000 population, highlighting challenges in healthcare accessibility and infrastructure.

title: Moderate Binding Coverage for Primary Products
description: As of 2015, Congo had a binding coverage of 52.18% for primary products, indicating moderate trade protection levels.

title: Low New Displacements Due to Conflict
description: In 2019, Congo reported only 2 new displacements associated with conflict and violence, reflecting relative stability in this aspect.
